# tips.txt

shows a random tip when you cd into a directory. pulls from tips.txt files and TODOs in your code.

## install

oh-my-zsh:
```
git clone https://github.com/ejfox/tips.txt ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/tips.txt
```
add `tips.txt` to plugins in .zshrc

manual:
```
source ~/path/to/tips.txt.plugin.zsh
```

## config

all optional. set in .zshrc before loading the plugin.

```zsh
export TIPSTXT_SOURCES="tips todos"    # sources to use (space-separated)
export TIPSTXT_ICON="ðŸ’¡"               # prefix icon
export TIPSTXT_COLOR="90"              # ansi color (90=dim, 33=yellow, 32=green)
export TIPSTXT_TODO_EXTENSIONS="js,ts,py,rs,go"  # file types to scan for todos
export TIPSTXT_SHOW_ON_LOAD="false"    # disable tip on shell start
```

## usage

drop a tips.txt in any project:
```
echo "run make test before committing" >> tips.txt
```

or just let it find your TODOs.

see [tips.txt.example](tips.txt.example) for ideas.

## contributing

it's ~50 lines of zsh. add a source, tweak the colors, whatever. PRs welcome.

MIT license.
